intro: Sumbavia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved sumbavia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and prefers well-drained sandy soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display. Sumbavia macrophylla is relatively drought-tolerant once established, making it suitable for xeriscaping in suitable climates.
